column_definitions: Difference in the proportions of cells expressed with CPM>1 in the foreground vs. the comparison cell types.
Difference in average log2-normalized gene expression (CPM) between cells in the foreground vs. the comparison cell types.

A metric defining differential expression using mean expression and proportion (from Sten Linnarsson's group).  Specifically, E[i,j] = ((f[i,j] + epsilon_1)/(f[i,j_hat] + epsilon_1))*((mu[i,j] + epsilon_2)/(mu[i,j_hat] + epsilon_2)), where f(i,j) is the fraction of non-zero expression values in the cluster and f(i,j_hat) is the fraction of non-zero expression values for cells not in the cluster. Similarly, mu(i,j) is the mean expression in the cluster and mu(i,j_hat) is the mean expression for cells not in the cluster. Small constants are added to prevent the enrichment score from going to infinity (we use epsilon_1 = 0.1 and epsilon_2 = 0.01).
Proportions of cells expressed with CPM>1 in the foreground cell types.
Average log2-normalized gene expression (CPM) for cells in the foreground cell types.
Proportions of cells expressed with CPM>1 in the comparison cell types.
Average log2-normalized gene expression (CPM) for cells in the comparison cell types.

The Rank Biserial Correlation Coefficient (r_b) is a non-parametric measure of effect size for a two-group ranking. It quantifies how well a binary classification (like being in group A or B) predicts the rank order of the items. It is intended to reflect both the purity of the groups and the direction of the sorting (e.g., A's before B's).

The overlapping coefficient (OVL) is a formal statistical metric for quantifying the overlap between two distributions. It measures the area of intersection between the probability density functions of two distributions. A low OVL value (min=0) indicates a high degree of separation between the groups, while a high value (max=1) means they are largely indistinguishable.

WLS_Slope is the slope is the slope of the regression.  Weighted Least Squares (WLS) uses means and standard deviations to quantify the significance of a trajectory. WLS is a variation of ordinary linear regression that assigns a different "weight" to each data point (with more weight assigned to cell types with lower standard deviation).
Weighted Least Squares (WLS) T value is a statistical metric that includes the direction and magnitude of the statistical significance.
Weighted Least Squares (WLS) P value is an uncorrected measure of the signficance of the WLS statistic.
Weighted Least Squares (WLS) P value is a false discovery rate (FDR)-corrected measure of the signficance of the WLS statistic.
Average log2-normalized gene expression (CPM) for cells in all cells in the trajectory.

A list of gene categories, including HGNC gene groups, ion channels, neuropeptides and more.  All gene lists are inclduded at https://github.com/AllenInstitute/CHARGE/tree/main/R/gene_lists. As of August 2025, these are quite old (circa ~2015), but represent a reasonable starting point for exploration.
Future link-out to the ABC Atlas (or other visualization )
